job.name: FTP

variable.name: HOST
variable.description: Hostname or IP address of the FTP server. Default value is localhost

variable.name: PORT
variable.description: The listening port of the FTP server. Default value is 21

variable.name: USERNAME
variable.description: FTP server user name

variable.name: CREDENTIAL_KEY
variable.description: Third-party credential storing the password associated with the given user name

variable.name: FILE_PATTERN
variable.description: Either a file name or a wildcard string pattern (e.g. file.txt, *.txt, **)

job.description: Workflow template composed of two tasks to Import /Export file(s) from/to an FTP server.

task.name: Import_from_FTP_Server
task.description: This task allows to import locally (data space) files from an FTP server. The task requires the following third-party credential: {key: ftp://<username>@<hostname>, value: PASSWORD}. Please refer to the User documentation to learn how to add third-party credentials.

variable.name: HOST
variable.description: Hostname or IP address of the FTP server. Default value is localhost

variable.name: PORT
variable.description: The listening port of the FTP server. Default value is 21

variable.name: USERNAME
variable.description: FTP server user name

variable.name: CREDENTIAL_KEY
variable.description: Third-party credential storing the password associated with the given user name

variable.name: FILE_PATTERN
variable.description: Either a file name or a wildcard string pattern (e.g. file.txt, *.txt, **)

variable.name: REMOTE_BASE
variable.description: A remote relative path on the FTP server from which we import file(s). $REMOTE_BASE can be either a path to a folder terminated by / or an empty value for the root (e.g. REMOTE/)

variable.name: LOCAL_BASE
variable.description: Relative path of a folder inside the Global Data Space in which the downloaded data will be stored. LOCAL_BASE can be either a path to a folder terminated by / or an empty value for the root (e.g. LOCAL/, /global/path/LOCAL/)

variable.name: CUT_FILE
variable.description: If true, delete imported file(s) in the remote FTP server
If true, import only missing files
variable.name: SYNC_FILES

task.name: Export_to_FTP_Server
task.description: This task allows to export files to an FTP server. The task requires the following third-party credential: {key: ftp://<username>@<host>, value: PASSWORD}. Please refer to the User documentation to learn how to add third-party credentials.

variable.name: HOST
variable.description: Hostname or IP address of the FTP server. Default value is localhost

variable.name: PORT
variable.description: The listening port of the FTP server. Default value is 21

variable.name: USERNAME
variable.description: FTP server user name

variable.name: CREDENTIAL_KEY
variable.description: Third-party credential storing the password associated with the given user name

variable.name: FILE_PATTERN
variable.description: Either a file name or a wildcard string pattern (e.g. file.txt, *.txt, **)

variable.name: REMOTE_BASE
variable.description: The remote relative path on the FTP server where exported file(s) will be stored. $REMOTE_BASE can be either a path to a folder terminated by / or an empty value for the root (e.g. REMOTE/)

variable.name: LOCAL_BASE
variable.description: Relative path of a folder inside the Global Data Space from which we export file(s) to the FTP server. LOCAL_BASE can be either a path to a folder terminated by / or an empty value for the root (e.g. LOCAL/, /global/path/LOCAL/)
